Nebo se to chystáte ve 114 opravit ? Učit se W10 a zadávat povinně heslo při zapnutí mě nebaví. Já mám rád vše free a bez hesel... :-) Nyní mám v. 104 ale pořád otravuje s aktualizací, ta bohužel nabízí tu nejnovější 113.

title: The width size of search-engine-textbox on Overflow Menu is no full size anymore, Firefox 113
content:
After update to Firefox 113, the width size of search-engine-textbox on Overflow Menu is no full size anymore.

Before update to Firefox 113 (version 112 or older), the width size is still normal: full size; like search-engine-textbox on Toolbar.

  • 5 screenshot:

[1]: Firefox 113, about version, link image: 1-About-version

[2]: Firefox 113, the width size of search-engine-textbox on Toolbar is full size, link image: 2-Search engine textbox - on toolbar - full width

[3]: Firefox 113, customize mode, the width size of search-engine-textbox on Overflow Menu is now full size, link image: 3-Search engine textbox - on overflow menu - customize mode - full width

[4]: Firefox 113, after customize, the width size of search-engine-textbox on Overflow Menu is no full size anymore. The width is so narrow, link image: 4-Search engine textbox - on overflow menu - after customize - narrow width

[5]: Firefox before 113, screenshot of another post (2022-may-04), the width size of search-engine-textbox on Overflow Menu is now still normal: full size.

link image: image on reddit

link post: post on reddit


Please review and restore the width setting, same as version 112 and earlier.

Thanks and best regards!

P.S.: I posted this on " Mozilla Connect > Discussions" at this link: The width size of search-engine-textbox on Overflow Menu is no full size anymore, Firefox 113
creator: zuumvuoogkagwkqpqa

title: Having trouble logging into sites
content:
I'm having trouble logging into sites with Firefox. One example would be preply.com. I know my credentials are correct because I can log in with Chrome.

I do have UBlock Origin installed, but I configured preply.com as a trusted site, so uBlock is disabled for it.

One interesting thing is that when I try to log in on Firefox, I see a message that sort of hints that the filled out fields (email and password) were considered unfilled in (i.e. "This field is required"). Almost as if the email and password were ignored.

It happens with other sites, but this is as good a site to diagnose as any.

Thank you!

Me pase a otra plataforma de streaming y también sucede lo mismo al ponerlo en pantalla completa, probé con una tercera y se repite el mismo problema. title: Sync has messed up the preferences, extensions and who knows what else
content: I’ve just signed in to my Firefox account for the first time in approximately two years. I’ve deliberately clicked “Later” when it suggested to sync my data. A few seconds later I found myself with messed up preferences, merged extensions, what else? (And that’s the worst that I don’t know what else is wrong.) There are three absolutely wrong things here: Sync has enabled despite I had explicitly said no; it didn’t ask what to sync before syncing; and it’s absolutely unclear how it resolves conflicts. I would very much like to know what exactly data was affected and what exactly had happened to it, and how Sync handles conflicts, especially in regards to extensions’ data. Thanks.

title: Firefox 113 no funciona en Ubuntu 23.04
content:
Buenos días. Como he indicado, Firefox 113 no funciona en Ubuntu 23.04. Si lo hacía la última evolución del 112. Sin embargo, aunque en un principio se pueda instalar, por actualizaciones, por Ubuntu Software, por Terminal, o descargándolo directamente desde la página web oficial, solo funciona durante la sesión que lo instalo, en cuanto reinicio el sistema, aparece una página en negro que no consigo quitar, hasta el punto que tengo que reiniciar de nuevo. Cuando funciona, he de evitar abrir páginas PDF, pues se bloquea TODO EL SISTEMA, no me queda mas remedio que resetear, por las bravas. Y va bastante mas lento e impreciso. 

Todo eso en cuanto al 113. Actualmente, solo consigo mantener estable el 112 primera versión, con una configuración antigua, marcadores desactualizados (faltan algunos), y he tenido que instalar un par de extensiones que habían desaparecido. Por lo demás, de momento va bien, pero imagino que esta versión no tendrá todas las medidas de seguridad actualizadas. Ademas en un principio, solo me aparecía en inglés, aunque ahora he conseguido que la versión en castellano funcione y sea estable (con mi configuración). Nada mas, espero que se arregle lo antes posible para estar actualizado y seguro. Parece que hay mas gente que le pasa algo parecido por lo que he leído en los foros. Hasta pronto.
creator: andrejkassovick16

title: Web page not displaying correctly
content:
Hi,

I've recently joined a new flight sim website - virtualflight.online.

One of their pages opens a world map and places real-time icons on that map to show the exact locations of fellow 'simmers'. If the page is scrolled down, then one is able to view various details of all of the people logged-on, and, clicking on any one person takes you back to the map (very zoomed in) at their precise location.

My problem is that on two of my Windows PCs this does not happen. When I log into the site I only see the world map but without any icons showing on it. However, if I scroll down the page I can still see listed all of the current users and, clicking on any one of them takes me back to the map (zoomed-in) and shows me (presumably) their location.

I have asked the question of virtualflight.online why this may be the case and was given the following answer 'The "who's online" is incompatible with Firefox - not sure why. I think it's to do with Firefox not implementing some of the scalable vector graphics interface properly.'

I would be grateful if you could give me some advice on this?

I also run Firefox on my iPhone and that opens up the web page exactly as it should and shows me immediately who is on-line and where they are 'flying'.  ???

Many thanks, Tony

title: Web address line autofill
content: Whenever you start typing a certain website name in the address bar, Firefox suggests and option to auto-fill the address based on what you've typed. My issue with that is that auto-fill keeps suggesting the address that I DON'T want it to. Specifically, I want "ya" to auto-fill to "ya.ru", instead it keeps suggesting "yandex.com.ge". Now, I have tried deleting all the history of ever going to "yandex.com.ge" as well as just ignoring the issue and typing out the full "ya.ru" by myself and giving Firefox some time to catch onto this, however after a couple of weeks nothing's changed. What's interesting is that when I type "ya" in the address bar, Firefox shows the following (in order): the wrong auto-fill suggestion ("yandex.com.ge"), some search suggestions (yahoo, yandex, yahoo mail, etc), then after the search suggestions there is a separator that says "Firefox suggests" and what do you think, the CORRECT auto-fill that I want is first right in there - "ya.ru". So Firefox actually knows that I want it, since it's the first thing in "Firefox suggests", but why can I not get it as a default auto-fill suggestion?

content:

title: mise à jour
content: J'utilise FF depuis qu'il existe. Avant, dans les paramètres, on avait des options pour les mises à jour. Je choisissais toujours « me demander avant d'installer mises à jour ». Depuis 2 ans, j'utilise linux. FF est installé par défaut sur Linux. Quand je veux choisir pour PARAMÉTRER les mises à jour, il n'y a aucun choix. J'ouvre souvent plusieurs fenêtres en même temps dans FF, pour les lire plus tard. Mais FF me dit de redémarer FF parce qu'il a installé des mises à jour !!! Parce que je navigue toujours en «privé», ces pages ne sont pas rouvertes au redémarrage de FF. Donc je perds beaucoup de temps, souvent au milieu d'un travail important, pARCE QUE JE DOIS RÉOUVRIR TOUTES MES PAGES ! ET IL FAIT CES MISES À JOUR DE FAÇON ALÉATOIRE, À N'IMPORTE QUELLE HEURE DU JOUR OU DE LA NUIT ! Donc je demande que FF me redonne le choix dans les paramètres. Je ne veux pas que FF installe les mises à jour quand il le décide, sans tenir compte de mon travail en cours. Ou y-a-t-il une version plus nouvelle qui permet ces choix ? Merci d'avance pour une réponse rapide. Anne
creator: annbess

title: Notification setting error
content:
I am trying to get a notification from this site( https://qualitywriters.net/pa/projects/ongoing-projects) and the bell indicating that I am "subscribed to the notification," but I am not successful. help, please. Note that the bell that indicates that " you are subscribed to notifications" appears on( https://www.prowriters.pro/). this is very important for me in my browser. Thank you.

NB: I have allowed notifications in permissions, as guided by your website manual.

However, this has not resolved the situation.

2nd issue. I want any automatic redirects to the site whenever I click on a popup notification. Let me explain further. if a notification from Mozilla comes on the PC, It cannot bring the Mozilla page automatically, I have to manually search for the tab and click it to bring it to the top of the display.

Thank you.
creator: accademicwriterss

title: Unwanted "Thank You For Loving Firefox" window on startup
content: Every time I open Firefox, as well as my StartPage Home page, an additional "Thank You For Loving Firefox" tab opens, and it does so in preference to my home page. How do I remove this "bonus feature"? In addition, an additional "Firefox View" button appears to the left of my home page tab, which I would also prefer not to be obliged to remove each time. Can I also disable this feature? OS is Linux Mint, desktop computer, with 2 TB SSD, Quad core processor, 16 Gb RAM.
creator: Ausron46

title: Version 113 has borders in fullscreen while watching youtube
content: I just upgraded firefox to v 113 64 bit with windows 7 ultimate. Now when I watch youtube in fullscreen there's a border around the screen. i don't use picture in picture and it isn't on yet the border won't go away no matter what I do. Please fix this or i will use another browser. i will include a screenshot from youtube in fullscreen mode look at it.
creator: ford1986f150
